args: Mitsuba! Sazanka! Take yerselves a gander\nat this here piece'a fried tofu!

Them grill marks make it look like the
spittin' image of Amaterasu's face!
Ya know, the one ya see in all them
fancy Hinomotoan portraits?
I'm callin' it ＂AmaTOFUasu,＂ 'cause I'm\nsure as shootin' the real deal Amaterasu\nis gonna approve of m'work!

Good thing too, 'cause I'd get cursed
quicker'n a greased hog if I went and
made a mess of it. Anyhow, stick there
for a sec and I'll bring a plate!
Swing yer tofu round'n round,\npromenade and don't fall down!
I know what you are going to say.\nThis fried tofu...

RIGHT?! I mean, I've never seen
Amaterasu in person, but I have to
imagine her face isn't some kind of
burnt...carbon...thing.
I have also attempted to find the visage of\nAmaterasu, but alas, was unable.
I saw nothing save crispy bits and a\nyawning blackness that swallows all light.
Is this just some kind of trick? I mean,\nis she only pretending so WE'LL pretend\nand then she can have a good laugh?
So you think she's serious?\nThat's even worse.
Yet it is a possibility; Kuzunoha is limited\nto a single piece of fried tofu per day by\nLord Seimei, after all.
Perhaps scorching her precious daily\nallotment was so horrifying that she saw\nvisions of the gods in its charred remains.
So you think her hunger might be causing\nher to see phantoms in her tofu?

Sorry to keep ya, but I had to get me this
paulownia box from Gozu! It's a right
purdy little thing, and perfect for storin'
yer keepsakes and geegaws.
We're veering dangerously close to idolatry\nover this bit of burnt food.
No need for the scunchy faces, chums!\nBest to be smilin' like ol' Amatofuasa!
Oh, but this is so sad... *sniff*

You need to pull yourself together!
I think she's actually waiting for us to
say something about how it's just a
piece of burnt tofu.
And the longer we don't point it out,\nthe more unhinged she's going to get\nabout it. We HAVE to comment.

I...I see. So you believe I should say
something akin to ＂Well, heck! That ain't
no magic tofu—it's just burnt to a crisp!＂
or the like?
It's either that or she's about to actually\nstart worshiping a piece of burnt tofu,\nwhich is horrifying.

So let's try dancing around it a bit and see
if we can't probe the situation—but don't
actually come out and say it, because that
might cause its own kind of trouble.
Mornin', chums! This here lovely day is\nanother blessin' of the great Amatofuasu!
We get it already! Hah hah!
The more I look at the great Amatofuasu,\nthe more splendid her face becomes.
Oh, definitely! Alhough her face certainly\nis a little...dark, no? Like perhaps she's\nspent too much time in the sun?
Yes, it's certainly well cooked—perhaps\neven a little TOO cooked for Amaterasu?

Hmm? A little tan seems fine to me.
Seems like just the sort of thing ol'
Amaterasu would do to get ready for
summer.
No, what I mean is...\nLook, the fried tofu is just...\nUgh. Never mind.

We tried treating it as a joke and we tried
gently nudging her. At this point, I think
poor Kuzunoha may have just lost her grip
on reality entirely.
In that case, we only have one choice:\nWe flat-out tell her it's burnt tofu!
A'yup! What can I do ya for?
Listen, there isn't an easy way to say this,\nso I'm going to be direct...
THAT'S JUST A PIECE OF BURNT TOFU!
Noooo! Don't give me the puppy-dog eyes!
Look, that charcoal briquette of a tofu slice\ndoes not resemble a goddess in any\nway, shape, or form.
Easy, Mitsuba. This reality is clearly\na lot for poor Kuzunoha to take in.
Correct is not the only path to good.\nSometimes a small lie is...acceptable.
Even if she's just bonkers? ...Oh, you're\nprobably right. I mean, just look at her.
Er, don't be sad, Kuzunoha!\nAmatofuasu is smiling upon you.
She...is...? I mean, HOT DANG,\nSHE SURE AS TOOTIN' IS!
Indeed, all of us here are basking in the\nradiance of Amatofuasu's smiling face.
In that case, it's time for us to be joinin'\nhands and prayin' together!

My dearest sisters,
Each day, I, Mitsuba, spend my time praying
to a charred piece of fried tofu in an attempt
to protect the feelings of a desperately
confused friend.
Today we'll ask everyone in the whole\ndurn Halidom to get to prayin'!
With each day, more and more join us in prayer,\nfor none can stand the idea of hurting the feelings\nof our dear companion.
I didn't mess up even once today!\nMust be the blessin' of Amatofuasu\nworkin' through this ol' fox.
Alas, I grow weary. Though we are doing this for\nKuzunoha's benefit, things cannot continue as\nthey are for much longer. It simply isn't right.
Shoot, Amatofuasu! Yer gettin' more dry\nand flaky every day! Better give ya some\nwater so ya don't blow off in the wind.
That tofu is just going to grow mold if she keeps\nthat up.
Forgive me, Kuzunoha, but there's just\nno other way...
Mmmm! I smell me some fried-tofu soup?!\nBut wait... Don't tell me ya...
I'm sorry. I know it was precious to you.
But if you were to waste food, the real\nAmaterasu would surely be saddened.
Yes, I have often heard that wasting\nfood will incur Amaterasu's divine\npunishment, but nonetheless...
Naw, it's all good, Sazanka.\nTime for this fox to face facts.
I was so sad 'bout incineratin' the tofu\nthat I ran from the truth like a hog\nrunnin' for the slop bucket.
But thanks for what y'all did for me by\nplayin' along, and also for turnin' m'tofu\ninto one humdinger of a dinner!
Everybody was mighty kind to me, which is\nthe REAL blessin' of Amatofuasu!
Well said, Kuzunoha! Now hurry and eat\nthis soup before it cools, or Amatofuasu\nwill be sad indeed.
I can't believe you got her to understand.
It was a surprise to me as well,\nbut I knew I had to try something.
Well, I think this is a fine day for both\nKuzunoha and Lord Amatofuasu.
...Huh? Kuzunoha? What are you doing\nin front of the stove—AAAAAAAAH!
Oh, heya, Mitsuba—take yerself a\ngander! If ya ask me, it looks just like\nthe Goddess Ilia!
I'm calling it Tofulia! ...Thanks a heap for\nyer blessings, dearest fried goddess!
It would appear that until Kuzunoha can avoid\nburning her meals, the creed of the Tofu Faith\nwill continue to find purchase in the Halidom...
